Don't be a Chump! Check for a Lump!

My experience with breast cancer was life changing and led me to make a difference in the fight against breast cancer by founding the non-profit Don't be a Chump! Check for a Lump! We our making a difference through education, prevention and direct assistance with free wigs for breast cancer patients.
Live and Give:Facebooking My Way Through Breast Cancer

While I was going through my breast cancer treatment I was compelled to write about my experience. Quickly, I realized I had a book in hand. While I do describe the horrifying details and terrifying emotions of my journey through breast cancer treatment, it is really a book about true love, a mother’s love, and friendship . . . a story about life and finding your blessings no matter what God has dealt you.
I graduated from UNLV but my heart belongs to NAU.  I'll forever be a Lumberjack.
I graduated from UNLV but my heart belongs to NAU.  I'll forever be a Lumberjack.

Holly is sincere and dedicated to raising not only funds for wigs for women with breast cancer under going chemotherapy but also putting out awareness and reminders to women to do their monthly self exams and mammograms. She does this through her Live and Give Foundation, and advises us to "Don't be a Chump, check for a Lump!"

summary: My fight with breast cancer 8 years ago led me to start the non-profit Don't be a Chump! Check for a Lump! My passion had led this grassroots organization to becoming a prominent figure in the breast cancer community in the greater metropolitan Phoenix area.  Since the inception of our non-profit I have helped to inspire and educate thousands of women with the facts and tips to lowering their risk of breast cancer. We have assisted over 800 breast cancer patients with a free wig, 222 of the women in 2016. We have hosted free mammogram events providing 45 free mammograms including any diagnostic testing necessary.  I'm honored and blessed to be making a difference in the breast cancer community. Speaking Testimony“Holly Rose combines the science of breast cancer with personal stories to connect with her audience. Listening to her is like listening to a close friend and by the end of her presentation you are moved to make a difference.”Testimony for a client receiving a free mammogram.“I am 37 yrs old I was diagnosed with triple negative breast cancer. I owe it all to Holly Rose because I had no medical insurance and had found a lump in September. I needed to get this lump checked out. I was actually her first client on a program she wanted to kick off by helping women without insurance. I am a single mother with 3 children and I couldn't tell you how happy I am to be a part of such a wonderful organization. Love ya Holly Rose and I am forever grateful.” Contact Holly Rose (Toner) at hollyrose@checkforlump.org 602-688-5232
name: Holly Rose
title: Founder/President of nonprofit Don't be a Chump! Check for a Lump!, Speaker, and Author
